about.help: <-- Note how the property info also displays the data type.

string_required.help: Any field can be set to required, so that it must have a value.

int_with_minimum_value.help: This integer value should be higher than zero.

int_with_maximum_value.help: This integer value should be below ten.

int_with_minimum_and_maximum_value.help: This integer value should be between zero and ten.

float.help: This is a floatin point field. It also accepts integers.

float_with_minimum_value.help: This floating point value should be higher than zero.

float_with_maximum_value.help: This floating point value should be below one.

float_with_minimum_and_maximum_value.help: This floating point value should be between zero and one.

enum.help:
This is a case sensitive (default) enum field. The value must be one of the following options: 
- Option1, 
- Option2, 
- Option3

enum_case_insensitive.help:
This is a case insensitive enum field. The value must be one of the following options: 
- option1, 
- option2, 
- option3

invalid_field.help: Invalid values are highlighted when you open the file. You can't save the file until you have corrected this value.

list_of_ints.help: All values should be between zero and ten.

list_of_floats.help: All values should be between zero and one.

list_of_enums.help:
This is a case sensitive (default) enum field. The value must be one of the following options: 
- Option1, 
- Option2, 
- Option3

list_of_enums_case_insensitive.help:
This is a case insensitive enum field. The value must be one of the following options: 
- option1, 
- option2, 
- option3

nested_value.help: JSON files can have as many levels of nesting as needed.
